channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We are Jerome Powell’: Gen Z finds an unlikely meme hero in the Fed chair via AI songs and fan edits
item.description: After refusing to bend to political pressure, Fed chair Jerome Powell is now the latest heartthrob.

item.title: Shark Tank’s Kevin O’Leary warns job seekers he’ll throw your resume ‘straight in the garbage’ if you have bad WiFi
item.description: Time is money, according to the multimillionaire Shark Tank star, and he’s warning that the grace period for video call glitches to be acceptable is o...

item.title: Vail Resorts is having a very dry year: It reported a record‑low snowpack, forcing the company to lower its 2026 earnings outlook
item.description: Vail Resorts is having a very dry year: It reported a record‑low snowpack, forcing the company to lower its 2026 earnings outlook.

item.title: Even Nicolás Maduro’s Prosecutors Are Tied Up Reviewing Epstein Files
item.description: The Trump Administration’s exhaustive examination of materials on the convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein is drawing resources from other cases.

item.title: Machado Presents Trump With Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The Venezuelan opposition leader’s efforts to share her award with the U.S. president have shaken some Norwegians’ faith in their signature soft-power...

item.title: Jensen Huang tells Stanford students their high expectations may make it hard for them to succeed: ‘I wish upon you ample doses of pain and suffering’
item.description: Nvidia’s CEO Jensen Huang thinks privileged Gen Z grads should lower their expectations if they want success.

item.title: Canada Strikes Tariffs Deal With China, as Carney Looks to Diversify From U.S.
item.description: China will in turn cut its own tariffs on Canadian canola products, Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada said in Beijing on Friday.

item.title: Adaptability is the new job security and 4 more future AI trends from EY’s global chief innovation officer
item.description: As we begin a new year, there are five AI trends shaping C-suite conversations. Each one represents enormous opportunities and challenges.

item.title: Stock Investors’ Strategy for 2026: ‘Don’t Fight the White House’
item.description: From oil drillers to credit card companies, President Trump has been a market mover this year.

item.title: Video Analysis of ICE Shooting Sheds Light on Contested Moments

item.title: Canada Strikes Tariffs Deal With China, as Carney Looks to Diversify From U.S.
item.description: China will in turn cut its own tariffs on Canadian canola products, Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada said in Beijing on Friday.

item.title: How Greenland Is Reacting to Trump’s Threats
item.description: Our reporter Jeffrey Gettleman is on the ground in Greenland, seeing how people have reacted to Trump’s desire to take it over. He and our senior writ...

item.title: Greek Court Acquits Rescue Workers Accused of Smuggling Migrants
item.description: The 24 former volunteers, including the refugee turned campaigner Sara Mardini, were prosecuted after helping migrants during the European refugee cri...

item.title: C.I.A. Director Meets With Venezuela’s Interim President in Caracas
item.description: The high-profile visit, which could be seen as snubbing the opposition, comes nearly two weeks after the U.S. military seized President Nicolás Maduro...

item.title: Thousands of Chinese Fishing Boats Quietly Form Vast Sea Barriers
item.description: China is practicing vast maneuvers that could be used to disrupt U.S. naval movement, a New York Times analysis of ship data reveals.
